title: Real-time wordometer demonstration using commercial EoG glasses.
abstract: Reading is an important part of our everyday life. Most of us read every day at work, in the transportation, at home, etc. Except by counting the number of books a person read in a year or a month, it is very hard to quantify reading. We want to create a "wordometer" that counts how many words a user read. Such an application could encourage people to read more, just like pedometers encourage to walk more. We propose a demonstration of such a system based on eye movements analysis extracted from EoG glasses.
